com.software.reuze

Class dg_a_EntityBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.software.reuze.dg_a_EntityBase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Comparable<dg_a_EntityBase>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    dg_EntityBuilding, dg_EntityMover, dg_EntityObstacle, dg_EntityWall

    public abstract class dg_a_EntityBase
extends Object
implements Comparable<dg_a_EntityBase>
    This abstract class is the base for all game entities.
    Derived classes should call one of the 3 constructors to ensure that all game entities are given a unique ID number which can be used for messaging when using state machines.
    Author:
    Peter Lager

      • isInDomain

        public abstract boolean isInDomain(dg_EntityDomainRectangular view)
        Determine whether this entity is inside or part inside the domain. This method is used by the world draw method to see if this entity should be drawn.
        Parameters:
        view - the world domain
        Returns:
        true if any part of this entity is inside the domain

        public void setRenderer(vg_i_Renderer renderer)

        Parameters:

      • getRenderer

        public vg_i_Renderer getRenderer()
        Get the render object. This is useful if you want to change how an object is drawn during a game. In most cases you will have to cast it to the appropriate type before using it.
        Returns:
        the render object.

      • handleMessage

        public boolean handleMessage(dg_Telegram msg)
        DO NOT CALL THIS METHOD DIRECTLY
        Handle a telegram message sent by another entity.
        Do nothing if this entity does not have a state machine
        Parameters:
        msg - the telegram being sent
        Returns:
        true if the state machine handled the message else false
